primary_phone.purpose: Confirm Phase-1 appeal mailing addresses and issuing authority routing for San Francisco parking citations.

serves.description: Most San Francisco parking citations are issued and processed by the San Francisco Municipal Transportation Agency.

how_to_recognize.notes: Standard city parking and transit citations display 'SFMTA' or 'MT' followed by eight digits.

submission_methods.notes: Citations can be protested online via the SFMTA website, by mailing a protest form, or by visiting the Customer Service Center.

confirm_by_phone.department: SFMTA Customer Service Center / Citation Review
confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm the correct mailing address and procedures for SFMTA citation protests.

verification.verified_source_note: Protest mailing address and process confirmed on SFMTA's 'Contest a Citation' page【111240306093384†L114-L121】 and contact phone 311 listed for assistance【111240306093384†L99-L101】.

serves.description: Parking citations that list the San Francisco Police Department (SFPD) as the issuing authority.

how_to_recognize.notes: SFPD citations are typically handwritten or printed by officers and may include 'SFPD' followed by a numeric identifier.

submission_methods.notes: SFPD-issued parking citations are generally processed by SFMTA; appeals should be routed through SFMTA.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm that SFPD parking citations should be appealed through SFMTA and verify mailing procedures.

verification.verified_source_note: The SFPD vehicle citation information page notes that SFMTA is responsible for collecting payment for parking tickets【178082751900936†L363-L369】; confirmation is required to ensure all SFPD citations route to SFMTA for appeals.

serves.description: Parking citations issued on San Francisco State University campus property by the University Police Department or Parking & Transportation.

how_to_recognize.notes: SFSU citations feature a campus identifier (SFSU or SFSTATE) followed by 5–8 digits.

submission_methods.notes: SFSU citation appeals can be initiated via an online protest form, by visiting the Parking & Transportation office, or by requesting forms via mail; the mailing address for returning forms is not publicly listed.

appeal_mail_to.missing_reason: The SFSU parking citations page describes an appeal process and offers to mail forms upon request but does not publish a mailing address for submitting appeals【416900924046845†L89-L105】.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Obtain the correct mailing address for submitting SFSU citation appeal forms and confirm the appeal process.

verification.verified_source_note: SFSU's citation appeal process is explained on the parking page; forms may be requested by mail but the return address is not provided【416900924046845†L89-L105】.

serves.description: Parking citations issued on UCSF campus facilities by UCSF Transportation Services.

how_to_recognize.notes: UCSF citations are numeric and managed through the PayMyCite system.

submission_methods.notes: UCSF parking citations may be appealed online via the PayMyCite portal or by mailing a completed citation appeal form to the Parking Citation Service Center.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm the mailing address and procedures for UCSF citation appeals.

verification.verified_source_note: The UCSF citation appeal form instructs appellants to mail the form to the Parking Citation Service Center, PO Box 11923, Santa Ana, CA 92711【693343670414183†L24-L27】. The UCSF transportation information page provides the contact phone number 415-476-1511 for transportation inquiries【435269882491184†L104-L106】.

serves.description: Parking citations issued on University of San Francisco campus property by Public Safety or Transportation offices.

how_to_recognize.notes: USF citations are likely numeric and include university branding.

submission_methods.notes: USF does not publish a mailing address for appeals; inquiries and appeals must be submitted through university systems or by contacting public safety.

appeal_mail_to.missing_reason: University of San Francisco's transportation pages do not provide a mailing address for parking citation appeals.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm the appeal process and determine whether any mailing address exists for USF parking citations.

verification.verified_source_note: USF transportation page lists the public safety dispatch number 415-422-4201 for immediate assistance but does not include appeal mailing details【19888143339817†L174-L181】.

sections.canonical_section_name: City College of San Francisco Police Department

serves.description: Parking citations issued on City College of San Francisco campuses by the campus police department.

how_to_recognize.notes: CCSF citations are numeric and identify the campus police department.

submission_methods.notes: CCSF instructs recipients to follow the instructions on the ticket or use the online permit portal to pay or protest citations; no public mailing address is provided.

appeal_mail_to.missing_reason: The CCSF district police FAQs state that instructions for protesting or paying a citation are on the back of the ticket and refer to the online portal; a mailing address for appeals is not provided【700214807916504†L284-L289】.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm whether there is a mail-in address for CCSF parking citation appeals and verify the appeal process.

verification.verified_source_note: CCSF's district police FAQ directs ticket holders to follow instructions on the back of the citation and references the online permit portal for paying or protesting citations; no mailing address provided【700214807916504†L284-L289】.

blocking_issues: SFPD routing to SFMTA requires confirmation to ensure all police-issued citations follow this process.
SFSU, USF, and CCSF sections lack publicly available mailing addresses for appeals; confirmation by phone is needed.
known_gaps: Citation patterns for campus authorities are inferred and have low confidence.
Several campus authorities rely on online-only appeal processes; mailing addresses may exist but were not published.
